newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore, U.S. navies in mine-clearing exercise.
newsitem.headline: Singapore, U.S. navies in mine-clearing exercise.

text.p: The U.S. and Singapore navies began annual mine-clearing exercises on Monday, involving three ships from Singapore and two from the United States, a joint statement from both countries said.
The drill, codenamed Ex Mercury, will run from July 7-12 and involve about 350 officers and men, the statement said.
"The highlights of this year's exercise include joint planning for and execution of mine counter-measure operations at sea by a combined task group of vessels from the two navies," it said.
Singapore and Washington enjoy close military ties. U.S. forces are allowed to use facilities in the city-state for repairs and logistic support.
